H0.text: Breathing becomes faster when the body takes in more food than it uses.

H1.text: Weight is lost if the body takes in more food than it uses.

H2.text: The heart rate increases when the body takes in more food than it uses.

H3.text: The food is stored as fat when the body takes in more food than it uses.

A4.text: Insulin is produced in response to rises in blood glucose levels. Binding of the hormone to insulin receptors on cells then activates a cascade of protein kinases that cause the cells to take up glucose and convert it into storage molecules such as fatty acids and glycogen.
